channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald, The Hand Behind Unmanned
channel.desc: Authors Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald discuss America's unmanned arsenal - from torpedoes to drones to automated technologies. Stanford University's Hoover Institution hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Gay Talese, A Town Without Time
channel.desc: Writer Gay Talese looks back at his reporting on New York City - a time capsule of the 20th century that stretches into stories of the 21st. His characters are gangsters, Vogue editors, doormen, bridge builders, and more.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Richard Vedder, Let Colleges Fail
channel.desc: Independent Institute senior fellow Richard Vedder argues that the U.S. government needs to get out of the higher education business and allow American universities to be guided by the private sector.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Steve Hilton, Califailure
channel.desc: Fox News host Steve Hilton argues that California is the worst run state in America and suggests ways to improve it.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Robert Spencer, Antisemitism - History and Myth
channel.desc: Jihad Watch director Robert Spencer talks about the history of antisemitism and its rise since the October 7, 2023, attack on Israel by Hamas.
